title: Klemzig crash: Drivers escape serious injuries after four-car smash
text:
Four cars have been piled up in a serious crash at Klemzig, but no one has been badly injured.

The carnage at Klemzig had police and emergency service workers holding their breath momentarily as they responded to the crash just after 8.30am on Sunday.

Just metres from the busy intersection of OG and North East Rd, the four cars collided, one coming to rest on top of another.

The drivers involved walked away except for one trapped man, who had to be cut free from his vehicle.

He was taken to Royal Adelaide Hospital with non life-threatening injuries.

media_camera The crash held up traffic for nearly two hours. Picture: Phil Williams

Traffic chaos ensued for nearly two hours while the cars were cleared and towed.

The incident follows an unbelievable near miss at Glen Osmond last month.

A driver of a semi-trailer smashed into multiple cars at the bottom of the South Eastern Freeway after its brakes failed.

Queensland truckie, Steve Phillips, 57, was driving the semi-trailer when it ploughed into seven vehicles waiting to turn right on to Portrush Rd. There were no serious injuries.
description: Four badly smashed cars, one trapped driver, and somehow no serious injuries  its got to be one of the luckiest escapes seen on Adelaides roads in recent years.
